dmca.title: Time Doesn't Want Richie Photos Dugg
dmca.body:
Dear Sir or Madam:

 I am an attorney for Time Inc., the corporate publisher of People 
Magazine.  This will put you on notice of a copyright infringement on 
your website  http://digg.com/.  This letter also is an official 
notification to you under the provisions of Section 512(c) of the 
Digital Millennium Copyright Act to effect removal of the detected 
infringements. 

 
Infringement of People Magazine's cover photograph of Nicole Richie and 
her daughter Harlow has been detected at 
http://digg.com/celebrity/Nicole_Richie_Introduced_Her_Baby_Daughter_Through_Magazine.   
Please _immediately_  (February 28, 2008) remove the infringing photograph and 
cease posting it on your website in the future.  Non-compliance may 
subject you to penalties and liability under the Copyright Act, and may 
result in a loss of the possibility of immunity under the DMCA. 

I have a good faith belief that the posting of the photograph on your 
website is not authorized by People Magazine, its licensing 
representatives, or the law.

The information provided herein is accurate to the best of my knowledge.

I hereby swear under penalty of perjury that I am authorized to act on 
behalf of People Magazine for matters pertaining to notification of 
infringement of its exclusive rights in its copyrighted material.

Please send to me at the address below a prompt response indicating the 
actions you have taken to resolve this matter.



Very truly yours,
 

/s [private]

 

*[private]*
*Levine Sullivan Koch & Schulz, LLP*
*[private]*
*New York**, NY 10036** *
*t: [private]*
*f: [private]*
*[private]@lskslaw.com
